intro: Fleischmannia rhodostyla, commonly known as the red-stemmed fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for pollination by nocturnal insects. Fleischmannia rhodostyla is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
